p: The seeds of N. glauca attained higher density under the canopy of mother shrubs than outside canopy in all locations (WHT, SHFA, and RDF). The seeds of N. glauca represent 60.4% of the seed bank in the study area. On the other hand, the relative density of the understory plant species showed substantial variations among the studied locations. The relative densities of the plant species were higher outside the canopy of N. glauca in all locations. In WHT1 location, Euphorbia prostrata, Verbesina encelioides, Plantago amplexicaulis, Polypogon monspeliensis, and Hyparrhenia hirta attained more density outside canopy than under canopy of N. glauca ( Fig. 3). While in WHT2 location, the Euphorbia prostrata showed more abundance under the canopy. In RDF location, Aizoon canariense, Eucalyptus camaldulensis, Pulicaria undulata, and Sonchus oleraceus revealed more abundance outside the canopy of N. glauca, while Heliotropium curassavicum, Chenopodium album, and Cyperus laevigatus were more under canopy of N. glauca ( Fig. 3).
